Recipe.Author: Christopher Van Eynde
Recipe.Name: Chris's NEIPA
Recipe.Notes:
*This recipe started as Stefan Yauchzee's Juicy Bits Clone which I edited to my liking

*My Target Water Profile (ppm) = 125 Calcium, 18 Magnesium, 25 Sodium, 75 Sulfate, 175 Chloride, 110 Bicarbonate
*Created a 1 liter starter using Wyeast 1318 London Ale III

***HOP ADDITIONS***
This brew will use 3oz each of Citra, El Dorado, and Mosaic that are divided between a hop stand and a dry hop addition.  These are not included in the recipe crafter.  

***Hop Stand****
-Once boil is complete, chill to 160-170, pause chilling and add 1oz each of Citra, El Dorado, and Mosaic
-Allow hops to stand for about 20 minutes, then resume chilling to pitching temp (leave hops in wort, can remove prior to pitching yeast if using hop sock)

***Dry Hop***
-Make all efforts to eliminate cold side oxidation for NEIPAs (see Brulosophy exBEERiment article below)
-When gravity reaches approx 1.020 add 2oz each of Citra, Mosaic, and El Dorado as a dry hop
-Gradually raise the temperature to 71-73 over 3 days to encourage full yeast attenuation
-Due to schedule issues I let it gradually fall back to 67 for an additional 4 days prior to transferring to serving keg with no ill effects
-Once target gravity has been reached transfer from fermenter to serving keg under pressure if possible to further minimize oxidation
-Enjoy!

http://brulosophy.com/2017/09/11/the-impact-of-cold-side-oxidation-on-new-england-ipa-exbeeriment-results/
Recipe.TastingNotes: Juicy New England style IPA loaded with oats and heavily dry hopped

HumanBrewingSteps.LoadWaterAmendments: Load selected water amendments (generally dry ingredients go in with milled grain, liquid ingredients in start water, your recipe may vary)
HumanBrewingSteps.LoadMash: Mill grain and load into mash compartment
HumanBrewingSteps.LoadAdjuncts: Load hops and other boil/whirlpool additions into adjunct compartments:
HumanBrewingSteps.LoadFermentationAdditions: Load dry hops and fermentation additions into fermentation keg:
